Survey.Name: Wellbeing
Survey.Note: Workshop version using WB01-WB05 column names (maps to WHO-5 items)

Description.en: Total score for Wellbeing (WHO-5 Well-Being Index)

InternalConsistency.Note: Based on WHO-5 Well-Being Index validation studies

Validity.Note: This is a workshop adaptation of the WHO-5 Well-Being Index

ScoringGuidelines.en: Calculate total score by summing all items (WB01-WB05). Higher scores indicate higher wellbeing. Raw scores range from 5-35. For percentage score: multiply by 4 to get 0-100 scale.
ScoringGuidelines.de: Berechnen Sie den Gesamtscore durch Summierung aller Items (WB01-WB05). Höhere Werte bedeuten höheres Wohlbefinden. Rohwerte reichen von 5-35. Für Prozentwert: mit 4 multiplizieren für 0-100 Skala.

InterpretationGuidelines.en: Scores below 13 suggest poor wellbeing and are an indication for testing for depression. This is adapted from the WHO-5 Well-Being Index (Topp et al., 2015).
InterpretationGuidelines.de: Werte unter 13 deuten auf schlechtes Wohlbefinden hin und sind ein Hinweis für ein Depression-Screening. Adaptiert vom WHO-5 Well-Being Index (Topp et al., 2015).

References.Citation: Topp, C.W., Østergaard, S.D., Søndergaard, S., & Bech, P. (2015). The WHO-5 Well-Being Index: A Systematic Review of the Literature. Psychotherapy and Psychosomatics, 84, 167-176.
